content:
I was working with EuclideanSpace and I would like to have access to the following instances:

import Mathlib

variable {ùïú : Type*} [RCLike ùïú]

instance (n : ‚Ñï) : Infinite (EuclideanSpace ùïú (Fin (n + 1))) :=
  PreconnectedSpace.infinite

instance (n : ‚Ñï) : Fact (Module.finrank ùïú (EuclideanSpace ùïú (Fin n)) = n) :=
  ‚ü®finrank_euclideanSpace_fin‚ü©

In particular, the second allows the use of stereographic projection in EuclideanSpace (stereographic' from Mathlib.Geometry.Manifold.Instances.Sphere). However, @Kenny Lau pointed out to me why certain theorems aren't given instances. Do the above instances have the right level of generality to be added to Mathlib? If so, where would I add them? I was thinking the second could go after the definition of finrank_euclideanSpace_fin in Mathlib.Analysis.InnerProductSpace.PiL2, but I wasn't sure about the first.
See the comment I left on your PR for the first one
I don't see the point of the second one. We shouldn't just add every Fact to Mathlib
The second one was because the definition of stereographic' needs such a Fact as an implicit argument. Is there a better way to get around this?
aha, in that case, yes, please PR with that justification

Sounds like the first instance needs revisiting per Kenny‚Äôs earlier comment, but the second seems justified if it enables stereographic' directly, worth a PR with that reasoning. Also, try searching related usage patterns on LeanFinder.
@leanfinder Adding Infinite and finrank Fact instances for EuclideanSpace to support stereographic projection in Lean Mathlib

Here‚Äôs what I found:

  • definition stereographic' (n : ‚Ñï) [Fact (finrank ‚Ñù E = n + 1)] (v : sphere (0 : E) 1) : PartialHomeomorph (sphere (0 : E) 1) (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n)) := stereographic (norm_eq_of_mem_sphere v) ‚â´‚Çï (OrthonormalBasis.fromOrthogonalSpanSingleton n (ne_zero_of_mem_unit_sphere v)).repr.toHomeomorph.toPartialHomeomorph "Given a natural number nnn and a real inner product space EEE with finrankRE=n+1\text{finrank}_{\mathbb{R}} E = n + 1finrankR‚ÄãE=n+1, the stereographic projection stereographic' n v centered at a point vvv on the unit sphere in EEE is a partial homeomorphism between the sphere (excluding vvv) and the Euclidean space Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn.

This is obtained by composing:

  1. The standard stereographic projection stereographic (which maps to the orthogonal complement (R‚ãÖv)‚ä•(\mathbb{R}\cdot v)^\perp(R‚ãÖv)‚ä•)
  2. A linear isometry from (R‚ãÖv)‚ä•(\mathbb{R}\cdot v)^\perp(R‚ãÖv)‚ä• to Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn given by an orthonormal basis" (score: 0.767)

  • theorem stereographic'_symm_apply {n : ‚Ñï} [Fact (finrank ‚Ñù E = n + 1)] (v : sphere (0 : E) 1) (x : EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n)) : ((stereographic' n v).symm x : E) = let U : (‚Ñù ‚àô (v : E))·óÆ ‚âÉ‚Çó·µ¢[‚Ñù] EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n) := (OrthonormalBasis.fromOrthogonalSpanSingleton n (ne_zero_of_mem_unit_sphere v)).repr (‚Äñ(U.symm x : E)‚Äñ ^ 2 + 4)‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (4 : ‚Ñù) ‚Ä¢ (U.symm x : E) + (‚Äñ(U.symm x : E)‚Äñ ^ 2 + 4)‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (‚Äñ(U.symm x : E)‚Äñ ^ 2 - 4) ‚Ä¢ v.val := by simp [real_inner_comm, stereographic, stereographic', ‚Üê Submodule.coe_norm] "Let EEE be a finite-dimensional real inner product space with dimRE=n+1\text{dim}_{\mathbb{R}} E = n + 1dimR‚ÄãE=n+1, and let vvv be a point on the unit sphere in EEE. For any point x‚ààRnx \in \mathbb{R}^nx‚ààRn, the inverse stereographic projection stereographic‚Äôv‚àí1(x)\text{stereographic'}_v^{-1}(x)stereographic‚Äôv‚àí1‚Äã(x) is given by:
    $$
    \text{stereographic'}_v^{-1}(x) = \frac{4}{\|U^{-1}x\|^2 + 4} \cdot U^{-1}x + \frac{\|U^{-1}x\|^2 - 4}{\|U^{-1}x\|^2 + 4} \cdot v
    $$
    where U:(R‚ãÖv)‚ä•‚âÉRnU : (\mathbb{R} \cdot v)^\perp \simeq \mathbb{R}^nU:(R‚ãÖv)‚ä•‚âÉRn is the linear isometry defined via an orthonormal basis for the orthogonal complement of vvv." (score: 0.755)

  • theorem stereographic'_target {n : ‚Ñï} [Fact (finrank ‚Ñù E = n + 1)] (v : sphere (0 : E) 1) : (stereographic' n v).target = Set.univ := by simp [stereographic'] "For any natural number nnn and a real inner product space EEE with dimRE=n+1\text{dim}_\mathbb{R} E = n + 1dimR‚ÄãE=n+1, the target of the stereographic projection stereographic' n v centered at a point vvv on the unit sphere in EEE is equal to the entire Euclidean space Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn. That is, the projection maps bijectively from the sphere (minus the point vvv) onto all of Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn." (score: 0.747)

  • instance EuclideanSpace.instChartedSpaceSphere {n : ‚Ñï} [Fact (finrank ‚Ñù E = n + 1)] : ChartedSpace (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n)) (sphere (0 : E) 1) where atlas := {f | ‚àÉ v : sphere (0 : E) 1, f = stereographic' n v} chartAt v := stereographic' n (-v) mem_chart_source v := by simpa using ne_neg_of_mem_unit_sphere ‚Ñù v chart_mem_atlas v := ‚ü®-v, rfl‚ü© "For any natural number nnn and real inner product space EEE with finrankRE=n+1\text{finrank}_{\mathbb{R}} E = n + 1finrankR‚ÄãE=n+1, the unit sphere in EEE is a charted space modeled on the Euclidean space Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn." (score: 0.739)

  • private lemma stereographic'_neg {n : ‚Ñï} [Fact (finrank ‚Ñù E = n + 1)] (v : sphere (0 : E) 1) : stereographic' n (-v) v = 0 := by dsimp [stereographic'] simp only [EmbeddingLike.map_eq_zero_iff] apply stereographic_neg_apply "For a vector vvv on the unit sphere in an (n+1)(n+1)(n+1)-dimensional real inner product space EEE, the modified stereographic projection stereographic' centered at vvv maps the antipodal point ‚àív-v‚àív to the origin in Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn. This is due to the symmetry of the stereographic projection and the properties of the orthogonal complement." (score: 0.732)

  • theorem stereographic'_source {n : ‚Ñï} [Fact (finrank ‚Ñù E = n + 1)] (v : sphere (0 : E) 1) : (stereographic' n v).source = { v }·∂ú := by simp [stereographic'] "For any natural number nnn and a real inner product space EEE with finrankRE=n+1\text{finrank}_{\mathbb{R}} E = n + 1finrankR‚ÄãE=n+1, the source of the stereographic projection stereographic‚Äônv\text{stereographic'}_n vstereographic‚Äôn‚Äãv centered at a point vvv on the unit sphere in EEE is the complement of the singleton set {v}\{v\}{v} in the sphere. That is, the projection is defined everywhere on the sphere except at the point vvv itself." (score: 0.731)

  • theorem finrank_euclideanSpace_fin {n : ‚Ñï} : Module.finrank ùïú (EuclideanSpace ùïú (Fin n)) = n := by simp "For any field K\mathbb{K}K satisfying the RCLike condition (which includes R\mathbb{R}R and C\mathbb{C}C) and any natural number nnn, the finite rank of the Euclidean space EuclideanSpace(K,Fin¬†n)\text{EuclideanSpace}(\mathbb{K}, \text{Fin }n)EuclideanSpace(K,Fin¬†n) over K\mathbb{K}K is equal to nnn, i.e.,
    finrankK(EuclideanSpace(K,Fin¬†n))=n. \text{finrank}_{\mathbb{K}} (\text{EuclideanSpace}(\mathbb{K}, \text{Fin }n)) = n. finrankK‚Äã(EuclideanSpace(K,Fin¬†n))=n." (score: 0.725)

  • instance instChartedSpaceEuclideanSpaceRealFinElemHAddNatOfNatSphere (n : ‚Ñï) : ChartedSpace (EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin n)) (sphere (0 : EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin (n + 1))) 1) := have := Fact.mk (@finrank_euclideanSpace_fin ‚Ñù _ (n + 1)) EuclideanSpace.instChartedSpaceSphere "For any natural number nnn, the unit sphere in the Euclidean space Rn+1\mathbb{R}^{n+1}Rn+1 is a charted space modeled on Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn." (score: 0.721)

  • theorem finrank_euclideanSpace : Module.finrank ùïú (EuclideanSpace ùïú Œπ) = Fintype.card Œπ := by simp [EuclideanSpace, PiLp, WithLp] "For any field K\mathbb{K}K satisfying the RCLike condition (which includes R\mathbb{R}R and C\mathbb{C}C) and any finite indexing type Œπ\iotaŒπ, the finite rank of the Euclidean space EuclideanSpace(K,Œπ)\text{EuclideanSpace}(\mathbb{K}, \iota)EuclideanSpace(K,Œπ) over K\mathbb{K}K is equal to the cardinality of Œπ\iotaŒπ, i.e.,
    finrankK(EuclideanSpace(K,Œπ))=‚à£Œπ‚à£. \text{finrank}_{\mathbb{K}} (\text{EuclideanSpace}(\mathbb{K}, \iota)) = |\iota|. finrankK‚Äã(EuclideanSpace(K,Œπ))=‚à£Œπ‚à£." (score: 0.720)

  • instance instIsManifoldRealEuclideanSpaceFinModelWithCornersSelfTopWithTopENatElemHAddNatOfNatSphere (n : ‚Ñï) : IsManifold (ùì° n) œâ (sphere (0 : EuclideanSpace ‚Ñù (Fin (n + 1))) 1) := haveI := Fact.mk (@finrank_euclideanSpace_fin ‚Ñù _ (n + 1)) EuclideanSpace.instIsManifoldSphere "For any natural number nnn, the unit sphere in the Euclidean space Rn+1\mathbb{R}^{n+1}Rn+1 is an analytic manifold modeled on Rn\mathbb{R}^nRn with the analytic structure given by the model with corners Rn\mathfrak{R}^nRn." (score: 0.714)
I thought I should update that I made the PR: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/28198. However, it seems to be falling to the CI bug from #mathlib4 > Failing CI :(.
You can try merging master into your branch again; hopefully the error will go away. If not, please report it again!
